line.en: The improved glider's test flight had been a\nsuccess.
In more ways than one.
While it did need minor adjustments, there were\nno large issues. Taking breaks flights, we flew\nuntil the sunset.
In that time, Asa, Yoru, and Ageha also got to\nride.
Asa seemed extremely pleased, and was very moved\nby the scenery she saw from the sky.
Flying with wings that we made gave us something\nmore than just flying.
After the test flight, Ageha came with us back to\nthe dorms, and we had a meeting to review the day\nwhile eating dinner.

It actually turned into a meeting full of
self-praise, where we said, 'Our glider is the
best!' and talked about how exciting flying had
been.
Afterward, I cleaned up the area.
'Whew! That bath felt good!'
Ageha came into the dining room while drying her\nhair with a bath towel.
She sat in front of the fan, turned it all the\nway up, and put her face near it.
'Big baths are so nice!'
'Has everyone already taken a bath?'
'Kotori hasn't yet.'
'She hasn't? What is she doing, anyway?'
'I don't know. Just sitting in her room alone and\nsmiling?'
During dinner, Kotori hadn't spoken much.
It seemed like she was silent because she didn't\nwant to be made fun of regarding everything with\nme.
And what's more, she hadn't spoken for the past\nfew days, so perhaps she had forgotten how to\ntalk to everyone.
'Why don't you go see her? I won't intrude.'
'After I finish cleaning up.'
Ageha looks at me with a face that says, 'I know\nyou want to go now.
I act oblivious and wash the dishes.
'And with this, I have made a comeback.'
'Kotori is your girlfriend now, so I have become\nyour best friend again.'
Actually, I feel like we've had this conversation\nbefore.
'But I didn't think you'd actually date her!'
'...What? Is there a problem?'
'There's no problem. In fact, it's about time it\nfinally happened! When did you start to like\nKotori?'
Ageha bends forward, like an old lady who loves\ngossip.
'I don't know.'
'You don't know...'
'It just kind of happened.'
I wonder when it was that I realized.
When I came to like her as more than a friend.
But even then, I wasn't thinking about her in\nthat way.
We were together every day, and we were so close\nthat Ageha called us best friends.
I didn't need to ask for anything more.
Maybe I actually began to think about it when\nKotori received that love letter.
Seeing Kotori get all flustered from receiving\nthat love letter from someone she hadn't even\nmet, I became unsettled in spite of myself.
I thought that maybe Kotori would go away.
Thinking about it was heartbreaking.
That's when I realized that I liked Kotori.
'Well, whatever. Even if you hadn't begun dating,\nshe was your best friend.'
'Sometimes it gets hard to know exactly how you\nlike a person.'
'Yeah, something like that.'
Ageha opened the fridge and took out a bottle of\ncider that she had been chilling.
Then she drank half of it at once.
'(gulp gulp gulp)... Ahhh! This tastes so good\nafter a bath!'
'...So you aren't bothered by this?'
'By what?'
'By Kotori and me... dating.'
'What do you mean? Are you asking if I'm\njealous?'
'No, not that. I mean, like... Sometimes it\nhappens, you know? Things get awkward or\nwhatever.'
'I won't know until that actually happens. But\nI'm happy that you and Kotori are dating.'
'Are you really?'
'You're both my close friends, and I really like\nboth of you. I'm glad that two people I like so\nmuch have gotten together.'
She says this nonchalantly.
'I mean, if I'm asked whether I'm jealous, I\ncan't really answer with 100 percent confidence,\nbut...'
'But there's something a little unsteady about\nKotori, right? Just watching her makes me\nworried.'
'But I think that if you're with her, you can\nmake her happy.'
'Ageha...'
'Or something like that! Maybe I got a bit\ndramatic just now.'
Ageha spoke jokingly and then finished the rest\nof her cider.
Then she picked up the remote and turned on the\nTV.
'Oh, it's already started!'
The variety TV show that Ageha watches every week\nhad already begun.
Ageha took a chair, turned it backwards, and\nstarted watching TV while holding the back of the\nseat.
I finished washing the dishes, turned off the\nwater, and wiped off my hands.
'All right...I guess I'll take my bath.'
'See you later.'
Ageha spoke while facing the TV.
'I won't intrude on you for a while, so do your\nbest!'
'...You didn't have to say that.'
I murmured this as I left the dining room.
'Hey, Kotori!'
'Kotori, are you there?'
'Quack!'
Hat poked his head through his special door.
'Is your partner inside?'
'Quack quack.'
I don't understand, but it seems she isn't there.
'I wonder where she went.'
I thought maybe she went into the bath, but I\ndon't hear anything from the bathroom.
'I wonder if she's in Asa's room.'
But Kotori is in a wheelchair, so she can't go to\nthe second floor by herself.
When she talks to people who live on the second\nfloor, it's usually in the dining room or in her\nown room.
'I wonder if she went out...?'
'Yeah... Yeah... Don't worry about me. I'm having\nfun every day.'
'I have lots of friends, and... What's more,\ntoday...'
'Um, uhh, it's nothing! Heh heh...'
'Kotori!'
I put my hands on Kotori's shoulders from behind\nand spoke into her ear, and she jumped up in her\nwheelchair like a cat and gave a shriek.
In doing so, she almost dropped the cell phone\nshe was holding.
Wait... Cell phone?
'I, it's nothing! It's just... That stupid duck\nplayed a trick on me.'
'Gosh, he's so much trouble! That stupid duck!'
She scowls at me and I mouth, 'I'm sorry.
From behind, the cell phone was hidden in her\nhair. I couldn't see it.
I thought she'd be staring at the stars, basking\nin a sentimental feeling.
'OK... OK... Got it. All right, I'll be waiting.\nGood night.'
Kotori spoke in a gentle tone she doesn't even\nuse for us, and then hung up the phone.
'I'm sorry.'
'...Come on! I made that weird sound, so my dad\nwas really worried about me.'
'You were on the phone with your family, huh?'
'Yeah... It had been a while, so I wanted to hear\ntheir voices.'
'And I decided to go home, just during Obon.'
'Really?'
'...Yeah. I always make them worry about me. I\nwant to tell them how happy I am right now.'
'I see.'
'Was your dad happy?'
'He seemed really happy... but...'
'He says he'll come to get me tomorrow morning.'
'What?'
'My dad is coming in his car to pick me up.\nTomorrow morning.'
'...Your dad doesn't waste any time at all, does\nhe?'
Coming the morning after a phone call must really\nmean he wanted to see Kotori.
'So we won't be able to see each other for a\nwhile.'
'Even though we... started going out.'
'Uh, yeah, that's true. I guess it can't be\nhelped.'
Kotori really seemed sorry, but it wouldn't be\nright to stop her from going.
'Why do you look so uneasy?'
'Well, I'll be staying at my house for the first\ntime in so long. And on top of that...'
Kotori slowly cast her eyes downward.
'I heard a little bit from Hibari. About why you\nleft your house.'
'It was really painful, wasn't it? Being with\nyour family.'
Watching her parents, who were engulfed in\nsadness,
thinking that she was the cause of it, and\nblaming herself...
It must have been so hard.
Kotori nodded silently, perhaps thinking back to\nthat time.
'But things are different now, right? A moment\nago, your voice sounded so gentle.'
'Yeah...'
'At the time... my mom and dad always looked sad.\nIt was like my life had ended.'
'Even though it was nothing more than my legs not\nworking anymore.'
'They thought it was their fault that I got into\nthe accident, so they always apologized to me...\n'I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry.''
'In my heart, I was always blaming myself. I told\nmyself I was the one who made my family like\nthis.'
'That continued for so long... I couldn't take it\nanymore, so I decided to leave the house.'
It must have taken a huge amount of courage for a\ngirl who can't walk to decide to leave her house.
But that means it was painful enough to make her\ndecide something like that.
'I wanted to run away from my family, but it\nwasn't just that.'
'I'm still alive. It's not like my life has been\nwasted. I wanted to prove that to myself.'
'That's why you came to Keifuu Academy?'
Kotori nods.
'Keifuu Academy is completely barrier free and\nhas student dorms.'
'You can get here in three hours by car from my\nhouse in Tokyo. My dad thought that if anything\nhappened, he could come here right away.'
'This was the perfect place to convince my\nparents to let me leave.'
'I lied about being interested in engineering,\nbut since I wasn't interested at all, things were\nreally hard after I entered the school.'
'And that's why...'
When I transferred to the school, Kotori was at\nthe top of her class for general studies, but for\nspecialized studies, she was near the bottom.
After she entered the Soaring Club, that changed,\nbut...
'It's amazing you could convince your parents\nlike that.'

'It seems they thought that even I could get a
job. Anyway, I had to choose a school that was
barrier free, so I didn't have many other
choices.'
'Hibari supported me, too.'
'I see.'
'That's why I chose Keifuu Academy. Now\neverything is really fun.'
'I have friends, there are things I want to\ndo...'
'...I ...found a... boyfriend...'
Kotori said this part nervously and grabbed my\nshirt collar.
'...I'm glad I came here.'
'Thank you for coming here.'
I said this and then rubbed Kotori's head softly.
Her hair was glossy and felt so good to the\ntouch.
Kotori narrowed her eyes as though it tickled,\nand then she blushed.
'And you were finally able to ride in the glider,\ntoo.'
'Yeah!'
Kotori suddenly became happy and raised her face.
'How was your first flight?'
'It felt great!'
Kotori's eyes sparkled as she spoke.
It was almost like she was reporting the fun\nevents of her day to a parent.
'It's so fun to fly through the air...'
'It feels even more amazing when you fly it\nyourself!'
'Yeah, it must.'
We haven't begun making Kotori's cockpit yet.
We had decided to begin after the glider's body\nwas finished.
Kotori rubbed her temples as though she were\nthinking of a plan.
'What's wrong?'
'There were too many great things today... My\nmind can't process them all.'
'I rode in a glider for the first time, and even\nif that had been the only thing, I would have\nbeen so happy.'
'And then you... told me your feelings...while we\nwere flying.'
'I thought it was the best time to tell you.'
'...Yeah, I'm sure it was the best. Even 10 or 20\nyears from now, I'll remember the things that\nhappened today.'
'Then it was a success.'
I smiled a bit jokingly, and Kotori made a\nserious face and looked up at me.
'I just want to check... Aoi, are you serious?'
'Huh? About what?'
'A, about me... do you really, um...'
'Like you?'
Kotori put her hand on her chest as though she'd\ntaken damage.
'Ooohhh...'
'What is it? Do you doubt me?'
'It's not that... It's just that I don't have\nmuch confidence.'
'It doesn't make sense for me to date someone as\nhandsome as you. Like one of the Seven Wonders of\nthe World.'
'Hey, why don't you try saying that after looking\nin the mirror?'
She doesn't realize how cute she is.
'Weren't you calling yourself a beautiful girl a\nwhile ago?'
'Yeah, well, I am pretty, but... look at my\nbody.'
'You're nice, Aoi, so... you felt bad for me, and\nthen...'
'I really like you, Kotori. You're cute, you\nthink of your friends, and somehow I feel calm\nwhen I'm with you.'
'Heh heh, I don't know about that... I'm always\ntold I have a bad personality.'
'Yeah, I think that's cute, too.'
'I'm... not happy... to hear that...'
'But what about you? Do you really like me?'
I figured it was a good time to ask.
'Of course I do! Are you stupid?'
She answered as though my asking were totally\nstrange.
'I mean, you're so handsome, kind, good at\ncooking, and have a mean side... And then, and\nthen...'
She lists off my good qualities, one after\nanother.
There were a few things that didn't sound so\nnice, but anyway.
'All right, I understand. Quit saying such\nembarrassing things.'
'So you understand how amazing you are, right?'
It seemed like she wanted to say, 'I told you so!
'...Somehow it feels strange for someone as\namazing as you to like me.'
She spoke with no confidence, hanging her head.
She's awfully stubborn, acting like this despite\nall I've said.
'So what will happen from now?'
Kotori lifted her head, and I put my lips on\nhers.
I had taken Kotori by surprise. Her eyes were\nwide open.
'Nn...Nnnnn??'
I put my hand on the armrest of Kotori's\nwheelchair, leaned forward, and kissed her\nharder.
'N, nn...Nnuu...'
With a start, Kotori rested her hand on mine,\nwhich was still on her armrest.
And then she squeezed it hard.
Her hand was shaking slightly.
'Kotori, I love you...'
I whispered this while our lips were still\ntouching.
Then I pressed my lips onto hers again while\nstroking her hair.
'N, fuu...'
Kotori closed her eyes.
She relaxed her body and enjoyed the moment.
'(Kotori's lips are so soft...)'
I felt pulled toward her lips, and even as I\nkissed her and she kissed back, they were so\nsoft.
They were so lustrous and sweet.
Our lips separated and she called my name.
Through her slightly opened eyelids, her teary\neyes, slightly twinkling in the moonlight, met\nmine.
I asked again while stroking her hair.
'...Now you understand how I feel, right?'
'...No, I don't.'
'So let's...'
'I guess there's no choice, then.'
I spoke softly, taking my hand off of Kotori's\nhair and pulling her in for another kiss.
Kotori looked up, shut her eyes, and abandoned\nherself to the kiss.
I wonder how long that went on for.
The wind blew, brushing Kotori's hair against my\ncheeks with a tickling feeling.
I put my hands on Kotori's shoulders and slowly\ntook my lips from hers.
'Haaa...'
Our kiss ended, and Kotori looked at me blankly.
It was like her soul had left her body, and she\nwas sitting limp on her wheelchair.
'Does that tell you my feelings?'
Kotori, still with a blank expression, nodded her\nhead.
'O, one more time...'
'...You're so spoiled, Kotori.'
I spoke in an 'it can't be helped' kind of way,\nand then lightly kissed Kotori's forehead.
'OK, that's it for today.'
'This is terrible service...'
'All right, here's a bonus.'
I kneeled down and hugged Kotori.
As Kotori is sitting in a wheelchair, hugging her\nis a difficult undertaking.
'Haau... Aoi...'
Kotori sighed into my ear contentedly.
'All right, how's that service?'
Kotori nodded, and then looked away shyly.
'All right, let's go back. You haven't taken your\nbath yet, right?'
'Huh!?'
Kotori suddenly went red and became flustered.
'N, no, not like that! I wasn't saying we should\ntake a bath together!'
'Oh r-right... Of course, that wouldn't be...'
'But if you insist...'
I said as a joke.
'*Staaaaare*'
She stared at me with those desperate yearning\neyes.
'...perhaps next time.'
'*nods*'
And for the rest of the trip I pushed the awfully\ncute and honest Kotori along as we made it back\nto the dorms.
Morning.
'Quack, quack!'
Shaking his bottom, Hat waddled into the dining\nroom.
Behind him,
'Good morning...'
Kotori followed behind, blinking her eyes\nsleepily.
'Good morning. You look sleepy.'
'...I was nervous, so I couldn't sleep well.'

It's strange to feel nervous to meet your own
parents, but when I followed my dad and lived
away from my mom for a while, I was a bit nervous
to meet her again.
Well, my mom didn't care about the inner workings\nof her son's heart, but anyway.
'What do you want for breakfast? I'll make it\nnow.'
'I'm fine, I'll just toast some bread.'
'OK, I'll brew some coffee for you. I'll make it\nstrong.'
'...With lots of milk and sugar, OK?'
Kotori prepared Hat's breakfast while talking.
Even while she isn't his owner, she always takes\ncare of him.
Hat is more attached to Kotori than anyone else,\ntoo.
'All right, here's your coffee.'
'Ungh... I wonder if it will be OK...'
Kotori muttered as she accepted the coffee.
'Are you still worried about something?'
'...My dad, he always dotes on me, so...'
'That's not a problem, is it?'
'Going home is fine. ...I'm just worried about\nwhether he'll let me come back.'
She slurped her coffee while talking.
'Oh, I'm sure he won't...'
'...You think he might?'
I remember her sister and think about it again.
'It's different than things with my sister. I\nhaven't really met with him in years, and...'
I'm starting to worry. Is it really OK to let her\ngo?
'If it really comes down to it, Hibari is saying\nthat she'll bring me back here, even if she has\nto abduct me. But yeah.'
I really wondered about that.
'Well, anyway, just relax there for a while.'
'Yeah...'
Kotori ate her morning toast with a mixed\nexpression of worry and happiness.
I prepare breakfast for myself and the other\npeople who are still in the dorms.
It's a simple breakfast, but it'll do.
Kotori was watching me from across the counter\nwhile I did so.
'...Don't even think about cheating on me.'
'What's with suddenly saying that?'
'I mean, you're so nice to girls... It worries\nme.'
'Hat! Hat!'
'Quack...?'
'Watch to make sure Aoi doesn't cheat on me. If\nhe does, you can really peck him, OK?'
'Gaa gaa!'
She doesn't trust me.
'I told you I won't cheat. I have such a cute\ngirlfriend, after all.'
While saying this, I stood behind Kotori and put\nmy hands on her shoulders.
'You're the only one I like.'
From behind her, I turned her head and kissed her\non the cheek.
'...(blushes)'
Kotori blushes and fidgets.
'Huh?'
However, she quickly scowls at me.
'Aoi, you're not taking me seriously.'
'Huh? Not taking you seriously??'
'I mean, kissing me like that... thinking I'll\ncheer up if you give me ice cream... you think\nI'm such a simple girl.'
'I, I don't think that!'
Well, I do tend to think it's a good idea to buy\na girl ice cream if she's in a bad mood, but...
'...Is this because you love me, too?'
Kotori says this and combs her hair upwards.
With a yearning look on her face, she says,
'Even knowing that, I want you to deceive me...'
'...Is that so?'
Well then I'll deceive her.
'(looks around)'
Kotori stretches her neck out like a meerkat and\nlooks around the area.
Then, after verifying that no one is nearing the\ndining room,
She thrust her lips out.
'Nn!'
Somehow she seems to be insisting that I kiss\nher.
'All right, princess.'
I went and stood in front of Kotori and then\nkissed her upturned lips.
Just for an instant.
They tasted like fresh coffee.
With lots of milk and sugar.
'Eheheh...'
Kotori smiled happily and then finished off her\ntoast with jam.
'Good morning!'
I heard Hibari's voice and pushed Kotori's\nwheelchair over to the entrance to meet her.
'Hibari! And also...'
A middle-aged man was standing behind Hibari.
He was dressed in a gray suit and had a\ngentlemanly air about him.
'Kotori...!!'
Upon seeing Kotori, her father looked like he was\ngoing to cry.
But he's a gentleman wearing a suit. His\nexpression only showed emotion for an instant,\nand then he changed to a classy smile.
'Have you been well?'
'Yes, as you can see.'
Then her father looked at me.
'This person is, um...'
'This is Aoi Minase. He's in charge of the dorms\nat Flying Fish Manor.'
'It's nice to meet you. My name is Minase.'
'Nice to meet you. I am Kotori's father, Takao\nHabane. You seem to be rather young...'
'Yes, I'm still a student... My mother manages\nthis property, and I am just working part-time.'
'But he's a wonderful dorm mother! Wouldn't you\nsay so, Hibari?'
'Yes, he's great at cooking, takes his job\nseriously, and is very trustworthy.'
'Wow.'
As both of his daughters had said such things,\nKotori's father looked at me approvingly.
While I held my head high, I felt a bit nervous.
I felt a bit insecure. While everyone said how\nresponsible I was, when seen by an adult, I must\nhave looked like just a child.
'Thank you for taking care of my daughter.'
After saying this, he extended his hand for me to\nshake it.
'Please continue to look after my daughter.'
'Thank you as well.'
After the greetings ended, the remaining dorm\nstudents and Ageha came to see Kotori off.
'Are these all of the dorm students?'
'Yes. They're all my friends.'
'These are Kana, Asa, and Yoru.'
'Hello. I'm Kanako Shigure.'
'Nice to meet you. I'm Asa Kazato.'
'I'm her sister, Yoru.'
After being greeted, Kotori's father bowed his\nhead politely.
Even when speaking with kids the same age as his\ndaughter, he never forgets to express his\ngratitude.
'Next, this is Ageha.'
'Oh, this is your best friend that you told me\nabout on the phone.'
Kotori's father, appearing moved, extended his\nhand for Ageha to shake it.
'Hello. I'm Ageha Himegi.'
'I've heard about you from my daughter.'
'Ahaha... I wonder what she's said about me.'
Kotori's father looked at everyone who had lined\nup and relaxed his expression, looking relieved.
He must have been concerned about how his\nhandicapped daughter was getting along in the\ndorms.
To tell the truth, we had gotten Ageha to come in\nthe morning on purpose.
Kotori had wanted to introduce her best friend to\nher father so that he'd feel relieved.
It seems that her experiment was a success.
Next, a duck came waddling in, shaking his\nbottom.
'Come here, Hat! I'll introduce you.'
'Quack, quack'
Hat flapped his wings and rested on Kotori's\nknee.
'This is Hat. He's my oldest friend here.'
'Oh, I see. What a cute duck!'
'Quaaack.'
'Asa, Yoru, please take care of Hat while I'm\ngone.'
'Leave it to us.'
'Be nice to us, Hat!'
'Quack! Quack!'
'Hehe, he's so cute!'
'All right, let's get going!'
'That's right. I don't want to intrude any\nlonger.'
Hibari pushes Kotori's wheelchair.
'See you, everyone. See you, Aoi.'
'See you later, Kotori.'
'Please have a relaxing time at home.'
Kotori got into her father's car and went home.
After Kotori left, we met at the dock as usual.
We have to resolve the problems that were found\nyesterday and, to be safe, check each part to\nensure there was no damage.
Ageha is in charge of maintenance.
Ageha went with me to the runway, got guidance on\nthe spot directly from people who had\nqualifications, and helped with maintenance.
'There are no obvious scratches on the surface of\nthe airframe.'
'There are no problems with the parts, either.\nAmane's design was great!'
Depending on the design, sometimes too much\nweight can be placed on a certain area, parts can\nbend, or damage can occur.
Yoru is staring intently at the assembled\nairframe.
'What's wrong, Yoru?'
'I thought this when watching the test flight\nyesterday, but... This glider is really\nbeautiful.'
'Designs are mysterious. The most beautiful\nthings come from the pursuit of function.'
'I guess that's how it works.'
This glider is a mass of functional beauty.
There is meaning to every curve. There isn't even\na portion of it that was designed a certain way\nbecause it looks nice.
Bicycles are like that, too.
Bicycles, which are built purely for speed, are\nextremely attractive in appearance.
'But this glider has a mysterious shape to it,\nhuh? It's the first time I've seen one where the\nwings go forward.'
Asa pointed to the wing and said this.
The wings of the revised model jut forward a bit\nfrom where they are attached to the body.
'Normally, aren't the wings of airplanes\nfacing... behind?'
Asa acted like her hands were wings, spread them\nout behind her, and demonstrated.
'Ahh, you mean sweepback wings.'
'Sweepback wings?'
'They're wings that spread out pointing\ndiagonally and backward from the point of\nattachment.'
'That's a design meant for flying at supersonic\nspeeds. That's why it's normal for jets and such\nto have sweepback wings.'
Whether they're passenger planes or fighter\nplanes, the majority of airplanes that we\nnormally see on TV are jets.
'Small propeller planes don't have wings that\npoint diagonally and backward. They're spread out\nto the sides, right?'
Our old model wings were that way, too.
'Why is the shape different?'

'Sweepback wings have less lifting power. If
there's a jet engine inside, a plane can still
fly without any problems, but that's not the case
for a glider.'
'That's why it's normal for the wings to stretch\nout to the sides, but this glider's wings are\npointed forward.'
'Wings like this are called 'sweepforward\nwings.''
'Sweepforward wings...'
'If you divide the wing shape further, there are\nstill a few more types, and there are some that\nare unclassifiable.'
'They are designed to go along with the objective\nof each plane.'
'So our glider's wings being... sweepforward\nwings? There's an objective for that, too,\nright?'
'Yes, that's right.'
'Well, rather than saying objective, maybe it's\nmore accurate to say there's a 'merit' in this\ncase.'
Ageha began her explanation.
'The biggest reason deals with the center of\ngravity and the portion that will become the\ncenter of the lifting power.'
'This glider has two seats, so we have limited\nchoices in terms of where to attach the wings.'
In the instance of this airframe, the wings are\nattached to the sides of the body, but the\ncockpit is also inside the body.
In the case of two-seaters, the cockpit takes up\ntwice as much space.
As a result, there's a limited amount of space to\nattach the wings.
In addition, since the cockpit and the number of\npassengers doubles, the center of gravity shifts\nforward by a large amount.
That's where the sweepforward wings come in.
'Look at this, Asa.'
Ageha draws a diagram of the old wings as seen\nfrom above and puts a point in the center.
It is just about in the center of the base for\nthe wings.

'This point is the center of the lifting power
that is generated by the wings. It's like an
invisible thread is hung from here and the plane
is flying.'
It's not really such a simple matter, but as\nAgeha was trying to explain in an easy to\nunderstand way, she was simplifying quite a bit.
'If the front is heavy and the center of gravity\nshifts forward, what do you think will happen?'
'...The nose will descend, right?'
'All right, how about now?'

This time, she drew a diagram of the revised
model (sweepforward) wings, drawing a line along
the center of the wings and creating a triangle
shape.
In the center of that, she drew another point.
That point was further forward than in the\nprevious example.
That means that the center of the lifting power\nhas shifted forward.
'Now there is balance, so maybe the front won't\ndescend.'
